data.title: Wonderful Place - Wonderful People
data.text: I travel approx. 200 nights annually on business. This hotel is a great place to stay while on business travel. The place is in the process of being updated, the people are what makes this place great. All the front desk team, including Lupe and others consistently greet me in a positive manner upon my check in and check out experience. It's located just off highway 10 near delicious cafes, etc. When in the Los Angeles area, I would highly recommend this hotel.

data.title: Excellent Stay!
data.text: The location is close to everything. Property Clean, Staff Friendly, Caring and Committed. Rooms Impeccable. I would recommend it to all. I had a great experience, and I would go back in a heart beat. Thank you So much Motel 6!

data.title: Motel 6
data.text: Made us feel welcome and comfortable once we arrived very nice and helpful staff was very nice rooms are very clean and have alot of room close to everything and transportation is very close by and there pet friendly so i really recommend motel 6 in el monte on peck road.

data.title: Just the basics
data.text: Good for travelers on a budget. There are no extras here, No refrigerator or coffee makers but the cable TV has a good variety of channels. However the rooms are recently remodeled and clean. The showers are pretty small like showering in an airplane lavatory. The staff was great.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team Member at Motel 6 Los Angeles - El Monte, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
 We are sorry that you were unsatisfied with the expected amenities; however, Motel 6 standards for quality are rooted in economical practicalities to consistently deliver on our goal to provide the lowest price of any national chain.   We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The next worse motel 6 current reviews have to be lies
data.text: This place was honestly the more expensive and least impressive. Roche's in room nasty matress'. Sink was not screwed down to basin. Very dirty and trashy furniture. Luggage rack broken and leaning. Trash all over parking lot. Small rooms very ghetto shower set up. One of the worst I have stayed in. Even the ice bucket was dirty. Not a family place the only nice looking thing here is the pool. I will continue to write the most honest reviews. I spend good money with Motel 6 they have continued to disappoint me each location.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team at Motel 6 Los Angeles - El Monte, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Christopher, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the comfort issues you describe. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Would stay again!
data.text: Was a clean and nice place to sleep.  We were out and about all day and it was nice to have somewhere to nice to relax.  Pool was nice, hotel personnel was nice.  It was right next to the freeway, easy to find, gas station right next to it.  Food establishments nearby.  Overall very satisfied with our stay.

data.title: Nice place !!!
data.text: Coming from Chicago on route 66, we stayed there for one night. Room was cleaned . Parking close. The best welcome we had in motel 6!!!!!. Piscine was there and clean.   Coffee available in the morning. This is very sad that wifi is not included in the price

data.title: Right off freeway clean hotel
data.text:
This motel in a very nice location, next to a gasoline station.

Paid fee for wifi.

clean room, budget price.

easy access to shopping and close to Los Angeles down town.

good hotel for crash a night.

data.title: Good value
data.text: I chose this property because it was located in a good neighborhood and was quite inexpensive! I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff. It's not the Ritz. It's not even Holiday Inn, but for the price, it was quite adequate. It had free off street parking, a nice pool and coin laundry. It is pet friendly, but that didn't cause us any problems with noise. Yes, there is some street and freeway noise. Again, it's not the Ritz. The hardwood floors were actually a plus, because you could tell whether or not they were clean, unlike carpet. Beds were comfortable. Only a small bar of soap... no shampoos or other amenities. I would stay there again.

data.title: Comfortable clean room
data.text: The Motel 6 in El Monte, California was nice. I had a clean comfortable room. It looks like the motel had gone thru a recent renovation as it looked like it had newer laminate wood floors. Everything was clean. The staff at check in was very nice. I  thought the bed was comfortable. It is in a good location near Interstate 10.

data.title: Bugs bugs bugs
data.text: This motel 6 is the worse one ever first room 127 my husband had bites all over his lower bodie was moved to another room that room 106 had little white bugs that looked like little ticks everywhere and got bit by a spider on inner thigh bite is the size of a quarter and black went to doctor and was put on meds for infection. Employee by the name of Gayle has a bad additude when i Tryed to tell her.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team member at Motel 6 Los Angeles - El Monte, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Amye, We strive to deliver a great guest experience, but it sounds as though we did not perform to our usual standards in this case. We take bed bug reports very seriously and sincerely apologize for your experience and for the unsatisfactory response you received to your complaint. Please know that we are on high alert regarding this issue and are mindful to monitor our rooms in order to address, treat and terminate any issues if we discover them. We have policies and training that should have prevented the experience you describe, but unfortunately bed bugs are a world-wide problem and present a unique challenge due to their highly transient nature, traveling easily in luggage and clothing. This is why we continually train our housekeeping staff to proactively monitor all guest rooms for the potential presence of bed bugs, and have standing contracts with professional exterminators to treat affected areas in case any are discovered on our premises. No room gets released until we have an all clear from them. Please accept our apologies that your stay was less than satisfactory. We encourage you to contact Guest Services at 1-855-787-9864 to further address any specific concerns you might have, and to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bitten silly by bedbugs.
data.text: Didn't do any research on this place as it is part of a recognizable brand. Had to change rooms ... was thoroughly feasted on by bedbugs. Seriously, if a motel has bedbugs in one or some of it's rooms that's a big problem. The a/c unit in the room I was switched to did not circulate cool air. This was v. uncomfortable due to the stifling heat in the valley. Internet service has to be purchased separately via vouchers for 24hr access at a time...why? Seen and heard a few altercations between some dodgy looking characters as well. Oh, and if you're sensitive about what you hear at night, better use selective listening techniques because the walls are thin indeed.

data.title: cockroaches! clerk not surprised!
data.text:
Stopped for the night with business partner on tradeshow trip.... stomped on 5 cockroaches and told clerk and she was not surprised...
only there 2 hrs and quickly repacked to leave after midnight! As we were packing car, a drunk
wanted to know if we were interested in joining him in his room...eeeww.
thought this was far enough out of LA..... ended up 30 min down the highway at a new place without bugs.   Bed had questionable stains on bedspread.   No coffee pot...no hair dryer... TINY ROOM... horrible... horrible.... thought motel 6 was better than this!  After filling out multiple forms... we got a full refund... btw... wifi cost additional.

data.title: WiFi highly unstable
data.text:
The pricing was OK, but nowadays we live in an interconnected world and for me internet based market information is crucial for me

at about 10 pm, the WiFi started to give me fits.

I had to log-in & re login at 5 minute intervals because the signal kept getting disconnected

frustrating is but an understatement

I last stayed at this El Monte outlet more than 10 years ago. The carpet condition is much better than Motel 6 LAX, they seem to be vacuumed & cleaned regularly

as I checked out, the carpet cleaning crew was hard at work

This Motel 6 location may house some homeless people with the tab picked up by the City of El Monte

I stayed over for just 1 nite

you get what you paid for; the TV channels were out of sync..

for example, I could be watching CNN; but the display on TV is displaying FOX

data.title: Crackhead and gangster hangout! Don't even consider staying there.
data.text: This hotel is a hangout for gang members, crackheads. The absolute worst motel I have ever stayed at not to mention how lucky we are to still be alive. Five hooded individuals (scum) stood out side our door and talked about raping my wife and killing me. This went on for over a hour in the middle of the night. We called the Police and it took them over almost two hours to respond after several calls to 911. We had to be escorted off the property for our safety. The rooms were filthy. What was I thinking. I should of known better when I checked when I saw the glass partition between the front desk and the lobby and you had to talk through a small hole in the glass to check in. Do yourself a favor, DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

data.title: Cheap by All Account
data.text:
We stayed at this place two nights in late December 2010.  The place was easy to find from the direction we got on the GPS.  Our first impression of the motel was not good:  the clerk sat be hind a security desk, conversed with us through a small hole.  I didn't think the area surrounding the motel really call for that.

The wall between the rooms was so thin that we could hear the guests from the next room talking all night.  Between their conversation and the traffic noise from the highway, it was difficult to get to sleep.  Bring your earplugs if you decide to stay here.

I have stayed in several Motel 6's.  This one was the worst.

data.title: It’s basic, clean, convenient and affordable!
data.text:
I visit hotels at least four times a month as a solo leisure traveler.  I have been faithful to a particular hotel chain and its affiliates for several years now to take advantage of the rewards / points.  I deviated from the norm and decided to try this hotel.  Booking the room via the web was seamless.  The young lady working the front desk was courteous and very professional (Thanks “E”)!!  This was my first time ever staying at a Motel 6 and everything was going great until I opened the door to my room...  Audible gasp!  The room decor was basic at best.  The Encarta Dictionary defines ‘basic’ as without or before the addition of anything extra.   And omg Encarta was right!
With that said after settling into my room realizing that I spend upwards of $90.00 to $150.00 per night for a room at other hotels chains would I stay here again or recommend this hotel.  Yes!  If an affordable clean basic room, clean sheets, comfy bed, close to freeways, family friendly restaurants nearby, AV jacks on back of a 19” TV (DVD player and Game Console ready), ample parking and a pool are requirements, stop reading and book your room.
Business travelers – The El Monte Airport is less than 5 minutes away via automobile .

data.title: Sure it's not perfect, but close!
data.text:
Was travelling throughout California and stopped for the night.  Was given my room by a very friendly gal at the front desk.  Asked her name and she gave it to me, and also said if I needed anything to call down to the front desk.  (Thank you, E!) The room was clean and smelled fresh, sheets and bedspread were clean and colorful.  The room was on the first floor, and I was able to park my car nearby.   Everyone I came into contact with was friendly,  and if they could not help they got someone who could!!! When it came time to have dinner they told me of two restaurants within an easy walk and mentioned where several others were. 
 Overall this was a great place to stay the night and I would stop here again if I needed to!

data.title: They try, but they're still awful
data.text: I chose this hotel from Orbitz because of its price and the fact that it was listed as having high speed internet.  No internet to be found.  They also list that they have breakfast, when really they only serve coffee in the tiny lobby. I had reserved a non-smoking room, but was given a room where someone had definitely smoked.  I complained about it, and the manager gave me a can of smoke eliminator- which it didn't.  The pool and half of the parking was under construction so it was hard to even get around the property.  It took me hours to fall asleep because of the sound of nearby trains and low-flying helicopters.  I then woke up to the sound of the garbage collectors, who took at least half an hour to do the job.  The area is unappealing and I drove for an hour looking for a grocery store, but couldn't find one.  The only good thing about the place was that the manager was nice and really wanted to be accommodating, but it was clear that this place was a dump.  Good try.

data.title: Très bon rapport qualité prix.
data.text: Un très bon hôtel pour le rapport qualité prix. Les chambres sont simples et fonctionnelles. La situation de l'hôtel par contre n'est pas idéal. Il faut compter 30 minutes de voiture pour ce rendre dans le centre de Los Angeles.
